website_summaries.verdict: This stylish and inexpensive tablet makes it easy to enjoy your favorite eBooks and streaming apps all day long.

customer_reviews.title: It's just an Amazon delivery device, but it's a really good Amazon delivery device
customer_reviews.text: People who complain about the Amazon Fire are really just complaining that it's not a traditional tablet. They wanted an iPad or a Galaxy Tab, but didn't have the money or were too cheap to get one and for upset when they realized what they'd bought. If you understand what the Fire is, an Amazon digital content delivery device with some tablet capabilities, you'll be thrilled with what it can do. If you're trying to find a cheap version of a Samsung or Apple tablet, keep looking because that is not what this is and you'll just be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: malevolentmuse

customer_reviews.title: Does not have google play.
customer_reviews.text: If you want an android device with all options and system controls open, this is not it. Buy something better, I regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive because they’ve got you ...
customer_reviews.text: There’s an advertisement every time I turn it on, and you’re stuck in Amazon world with this thing. I can’t download my public library’s app or my work-out app. It’s inexpensive because you’ll be nickel and dimed, and pushed into a corner!
customer_reviews.author: BearBait

customer_reviews.title: Fire HD 8 tablet don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely not! In fact I was so displeased I returned it! My messenger program never would act right n little by little all of the other icons on my app stopped working correctly! I talked with three different agents who tried to make it operate correct n reset all my settings but nothing helped! So I decided to return it! But I agreed to allow you to replace it hoping that it was just a glitch in this one. If the next one operates as poorly as this one did I will be returning it also! Totally NOT recommending this dud to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Janette M. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent e-reader; Not a iPad or Tablet substitute
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a nearly 10 year old kindle fire. I'll mostly use this for reading and the occasional movie, for those it works great, and I'm very happy. Do not buy this if you want a replacement or alternative to an iPad or an Android tablet. Access to apps is very limited, you do not have google play like other android tablets. The camera is also very low end, so don't buy expecting to take photos or video. If you buy this with the expectation of a very good e-reader, then you will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McInnis

customer_reviews.title: Boots up fast, smooth screen movement, long battery charge, ideal for travel.👍
customer_reviews.text: I am a big user of Amazon products like Fire tablets and Alexa. This HD 8 boots up extremely fast. The screen movement is very smooth. I own an HD 10 but I like this better because the size makes it easier to hold and manuever. It is much lighter than the 10. I had a concern about the sound quality before receiving it but the sound quality is very good. The charge time is fast and the battery holds charge for a long time. Because of all these positives I will be using this tablet over my 10 on my next trip. I really like this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: happy listener

customer_reviews.title: Not a Kindle 8!!😡😡
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Kindle fire 8. It is not the same! The Bluetooth does not connect, or reconnect, without multiple steps. The wifi does not auto connect. I have to sign into my Xfinity account over and over. The camera, and the light monitor, are on the side now. This means when you are reading, the reason I BUY a Kindle, it dims when you hold it. If I wanted a tablet for contacting ppl, I'd have bought one. I buy the Kindle to read, and sometimes watch TV. They should not call it a Kindle 8 if it's not the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: I had to return my tablet
customer_reviews.text: The first week everything was working fine after that I started a ring problems. For almost a week it wouldn’t connect to wi-fi, I called customer support and was told Amazon was aware of the problem and working on it and it would take about 3 day. To make a long story short it still wouldn’t stay connected to my WiFi. It was not a problem with my WiFi service because I have other devices and was not experiencing problem with them. I had no other choice but to return.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine M.

customer_reviews.title: Messed with the charging port and on button.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third or fourth kindle/fire tablet. This newest model seems fine, but I'm seriously miffed that they changed where the on/off button is, so I can't use my old case. And it definitely needs a case, it's very light and thin. They also switched from the mini USB B to the mini USB C charger, so now I can't use any of the 6 chargers I have, including the extra long ones that I used to charge it while I read in bed. Out of princjple, I will not be buying the replacement case or chargers on Amazon! The product would have gotten more stars, but I'm really mad.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Barrineau

customer_reviews.title: This Tablet is not the same as past 8" tablets.
customer_reviews.text: Was not aware that it would be different and is not the same size but smaller. I am very upset as it is much higher & then had to buy another case. They should have stated in description that it wasn't the same.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Hamby

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: I preordered the PLUS version with the wireless charging station. I love it. I like the idea of just one pacing it and walking away instead of plugging and unplugging every time it’s low. It is faster than its predecessor and it runs smoothly. One thing I wasn’t too happy about was that there are no other color options to the PLUS only Slate. I like how it looks when the tablet and the case are the same color, I got the Twilight Blue case, but that alone is not enough to drop the rating. I’m very satisfied with this purchase. It was a well worth upgrade for me.
customer_reviews.author: Esaul44

customer_reviews.title: no help from Help
customer_reviews.text: would not allow me to set up or open my email acccount. Contacted help, they could not help, said they would call me back, never called back. Help is extremely hard to contact. device would just shut off whenever it felt like it, it the middle of reading, middle of playing a game. awful. I had device charged 100% in less than an hour and 1/2, the battery had already ran down to 50% was was continuing to lose life, fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It will not turn on after one week
customer_reviews.text: Amazon has gotten even more invasive, everything demanded access to contacts, camera, microphone, pictures, memory, and I guess anything else on it. I recommend not using for email or storing pictures. But I guess it doesn’t matter, the fire will not turn on, black screen, one week old. And it’s slightly different size means you have to buy new cases. My old fire 8 still works but the charging port is loose and won’t charge the device unless you prop it up so there is pressure on the plug. I enjoy reading books from Amazon, but not sure it worth the privacy concerns.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Bounds

customer_reviews.title: Returning within one hour of receipt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to use as an eReader, primarily of Amazon content. Upon receipt, I tried to return a Kindle Unlimited magazine so I could borrow another. No way to do so on the tablet. I talked to an Amazon tech rep for almost 20 minutes, she also cannot figure out how to return a magazine title. The ironic thing? If you search Amazon for "how to return a Kindle Unlimited book" - it tries to SELL YOU A BOOK that tells you how to return a book!
customer_reviews.author: Steven R Mountz

customer_reviews.title: Fills screens with unwanted recommendations
customer_reviews.text: Super intrusive. Can't get it to stop filling the screens with unwanted 'recommendations'. As a grown up I don't give a fig what some company thinks I should read next. I spend more time deleting them that I haven't had time to actually read much. This was to replace my other kindle but I just got it working again so I will probably not use this one much.This one has very little user friendly settings. Regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: The tablet powers down unexpectedly and the only way to get it to turn on is to attach power charger. I worked with Amazon support on a text to speech issue and Amazon said the problem is the text to speech feature only works on books recently published (last year or two) EDITED: Now that I have purchased newly released books what Amazon said is false. The text to speech doesn't work on new books. It won't read a book published on July 13, 2020. I haven't seen any notable processor speed difference either. The battery life does seem to be better. I am concerned though with how warm the adapter gets when plugged into electrical outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If the apps you want aren't in the Amazon store you don't want this tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment. I wanted a larger screen to play my favorite smartphone games on and since I already had a Fire TV stick I went with a Fire tablet. Too bad the Amazon game store doesn't have the games I wanted to play. So I can't use this tablet for what I planned until I figure out a workaround to install the games I want. Should have gone with a cheaper off brand tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way this tablet charges. This tablet is replacing a 7 inch HDX fire tablet that is many years old. Wasn't going to ever purchase another fire but this one looked decent and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: janice399

customer_reviews.title: Fulfills expectations
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice little devise and does what I expected it to do. It is not as refined as other more expensive products but works well. There is no easy access to Google play and that is disappointing but expected. Intended use: news publications, books, social media and video.
customer_reviews.author: Kontrar

customer_reviews.title: The HD 10 is better
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed by the sub-quality performance~ compared to the HD `10- I would have returned the HD 8 and exchanged it for the HD 10 if it were not so troublesome- I gave it to my daughter (age 9) and she gives it a 5 star review- so I balanced it with my review- so it is about a 2.5-3 range. Her thoughts are- the size is perfect for her hands and the battery life and speed is superior to any tablet she has used to date.
customer_reviews.author: Master Ma

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the money
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is great. I recently purchased the 9th gen when it was on sale. That tablet was a little sluggish but a good deal at $50. As soon as this one came out I traded in my 9th generation. I'm so glad I did. This tablet is so much snappier and smoother than the 9th generation Good upgrades on it. it's also a bit smaller not the screen size just the bevel around the screen. Screen is sharp and bright. I highly recommend this tablet especially when you put the Google play store on it. I use it for light web browsing, Facebook, Netflix, YouTube and a few other apps. Works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Intrusive new fire.
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy at how intrusive this new device is. I had to spend hours to figure out how to stop the special offers and finally had to pay $15 to remove it, as it was part of the small print of the agreement. Other notifications continue and are also very tiresome to close. I am sorry to have traded in my previous fire kindle for this. Shame on you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: No mirroring!
customer_reviews.text: What is the point of having Amazon Fire TV and Amazon Fire Tablet if they don't talk to each other? It is not possible to mirror Tablet on TV. If Amazon is not updating neither systems you should at least create an App, otherwise people will just change their platform choice to Google. Chromecast mirrors devices perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Ouriques

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed 😞
customer_reviews.text: I am totally disappointed with the Kindle. I have been a HUGE fan of all kindle products since the very beginning. I am a Prime Member, Kindle Unlimited Member, and Audible Escapes Member. However, with the latest Kindles and updates, I will no longer be using my Kindle, nor buying any new Kindles. Why should I have to go to the website to buy or borrow audible books when I used to be able to just use the app, like I do on my androids. Amazon is now making things more complicated, instead of integrated. Its as if we a taking 10 steps backwards, instead or progressing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waiting to find out
customer_reviews.text: I can't write a true review at this time. I have a call into the Amazon Kindle help because I haven't been able to download any of my books. It has been almost three days and I haven't heard back from them yet. The representative I spoke with tried a couple of fixes, but couldn't pinpoint what might be causing the problem. She was going to consult with her supervisor and see what things might be the problem. Waiting is. So I haven't been able to fully enjoy this KIndle Fire. Once I get it working properly or they replace this one, I will have a better idea.
customer_reviews.author: blewis

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved - Buy it!!  Was -If you already have a Kindle Fire do NOT buy this "upgrade"
customer_reviews.text: This"upgraded" Fire does not have a documents folder and hence you cannot see a library of the books that you import via Send-to-Kindle UPDATE With great outreach fro Amazon in response to my original posting I can confirm that the Documents folder on this version of the Kindle is inside a new Utilities Folder. It is easy to move the Documents folder out of the Utilities folder and put it on the home page. Books imported using Send to Kindle automatically go to the Documents folder.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: HUGE disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for my previous Fire 8 that suddenly died. I purposely bought the same size so I could use the same case I purchased for the earlier model, since I like the case and it's in great shape. UNFORTUNATELY, not only is this new Kindle a different size, the charging port and buttons are in different places, making my perfectly good case useless for anything now. Then, to add insult to injury, the charging port now uses a different style of cord, also making the braided cords I specifically purchased completely useless. I was ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Mikki, Lenny's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Issues with new Kindle Fire.
customer_reviews.text: Frustrated with this product. Cannot seem to download books. After discussion with customer service thought it was fixed. It is not. Plus new cord change with new version. Original cords will not work. More ways For amazon to make a bit more Money.
customer_reviews.author: Jgaboriau

customer_reviews.title: Wrong charger for charging port.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this tablet for my daughter. It all worked fine until it came time to charge. The charging cable that was in the box did not fit the charging port. I have tried to research what type of charger I should buy in its place and still haven’t found the right one. The charging port is not a micro USB port but the charging cable supplied is. So it worked wonderful for the one day it did work.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Not a good value.
customer_reviews.text: The screen flickered. The Amazon app, running on the Fire, was worse than any other machine we use. It was missing all the features we use and are available on non-Amazon devices. Sent it back after 3 days of delivery frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as when I bought my first one.
customer_reviews.text: It heats up like it has been on too long, even when you just turned it on.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Gunn

customer_reviews.title: I upgraded and I'm glad I did
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice product. I really like the quality of it. I had an older and smaller Fire tablet that I liked, but this make the old one look like it was 1990s tech.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J

customer_reviews.title: Charger not included.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived sealed but without a charger which seemed very odd. Getting them to send a charger was near impossible. After hours of explaining to people I can only assume don’t understand English, I gave up. I bought a charger and am about to end my amazon relationship. This company has lost quality and common sense.
customer_reviews.author: 1Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy not worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is awful u can’t get any of the apps that are needed like my banking app and a bunch of apps that are on the fire stick are not available on this tablet waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Twiztedpsycho10

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage don't buy this device. Wifi connection kept disconnecting. Can't access Amazon store cause it keep popping authentication failure. Took me almost an hr trying to set this garbage up. This device is going back. Spend a little more money guys instead of this garbage
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: All applications that you may want has to be downloaded from Amazon. You must be logged on to Amazon and being as though I purchased this tablet for a 5 year old, I really didn't feel comfortable doing that. Camara was low quality and it was on the charger if we weren't trying to figure out how to use it.. The lock screen came on constantly and trying to get kid videos to play was difficult. Unless you're in abundance of free time I wouldn't recommend this product because it takes alot of time to maneuver through the device.
customer_reviews.author: Estella Boykin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Just got yesterday but it's awesome so far. I wish that Amazon offered more apps but it's more than I was expecting. It's a great size and the battery life has been really great. I got it as an anniversary gift for my husband and he's been kinda obsessed with it. The forward facing camera is on one of the sides as opposed to the top of the screen where it traditionally is but the placement seems more convenient for taking pictures and video chatting.
customer_reviews.author: Britknee Drey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Proprietary "Tablet"
customer_reviews.text: Wellllll, I could only give this a 3 star Overall rating because this is Amazon's version of a tablet. It doesn't do nearly what a Samsung or Lenovo tablet does - act as a mini-computer. It's great for Kindle but Amazon wants you to use their apps for email along with some other apps. I downloaded the Chrome app so occasionally I'll go to webmail and FB since I prefer a larger screen than my phone. My daughter-in-law also bought one and we both agree: it is not as user friendly as my Samsung was or her iPad was.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sliger

customer_reviews.title: cannot take videos or pictures from within freetime app
customer_reviews.text: i bought 2 of these soley for my kids to be able to use freetime and also kids messenger and there is some sort of bug in the system that prevents kids from doing video or photos from within the app. The help around this has been really frustrating and it should really be disclosed up front
customer_reviews.author: Catfish

customer_reviews.title: Good Clear Picture
customer_reviews.text: Love the speed and the good clear picture. The only thing I don't like is that I have many Kindles and Android phones and all my chargers are compatible....Except this one. Had that been in the description, I would have gone with the older Fire HD 8 which I have several of for my Grandchildren and we love. Now I have to buy another charger as I always keep one in a travel bag for emergencies and since the old ones don't fit, I need a spare. Also, my car chargers are all the older ones.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa R.

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend the base is 8
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 hd 8 tablets one for me and one for my mother. There's almost always lag on the internet when you type something in or even scrolling up or down on pages . I type and nothing happens for 4 or 5 seconds which is very annoying. if you have just 3 tabs open it starts to slow down and has to reload pages its awful. I don't think the base model has enough ram to function properly. Wish I would have purchased the plus model for the extra ram. These tablets also have horrible wifi. I'm about 12 feet away from my wifi router and I have 2 bars while all my other devices have full bars.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Upgrade-With One Exception
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint so far is, because of the fast processer, that the touchscreen is too sensitive while reading. Ideally, the page-turning function could have a sensitivity control. It turns the page so fast that if you blink you do not know the page has been turned (by touching, not by moving it across with your finger. Also, the page-flip function, where the page looks like a real page-turning, is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: DFWJack

customer_reviews.title: New 8 HD Fire Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I do like the square size of this kindle. Makes it easier to hold. I have a 10" and I don't use it because it is so TOP heavy. The square size is perfect. What I don't like is that I couldn't transfer my SD card from my old Kindle to the new Kindle 2020. Plus I had a game on there that is no longer found in Apps store....but then I couldn't locate the HP app either. Had to go somewhere else to get it. Not good. So I gave it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet for the extra memory space it has but so far I wasn't able to transfer the content of my old tablet. I have games I have been playing for a long time reaching levels well over 1,000 .After 2 days of googling and trying I am unsuccessful. I emailed customer service 4 days ago and still no answer. I took a few pictures with it but the quality is poor. I don't know if it was worth it. Maybe it's time to spend more money and upgrade to an iPad and leave this one for my grandkids to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Plant lady

customer_reviews.title: I hate that they changed the button configuration, camera location, and power cord
customer_reviews.text: This is great on power and looks great. The issues I had with it may not bother some, but I really do not like them. They moved the power button by the volume buttons which I thought would make sense, but it feels awkward. It is located toward the middle of the machine. I understand why this happened as it is for entertainment and I assume that includes social features like Zoom or Skype, but I usually hold mine like a book when taking pictures and it makes it difficult with the new arrangement. I am the crazy about the C cord either. We have multiple Kindles in my home and the great thing was any charger would do
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Meaders

customer_reviews.title: HD Fire 8 For Seniors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 92-year-old mother so that she could read and adjust the font size, and so that she could listen to audiobooks. All of the features are terrific except one thing that was very important - the volume on the audio. At 92, she needs strong sound, and this was not sufficient. The Kindle is wonderful for seniors. I hope that the audio volume is increased - this will help the seniors tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life + Size = Perfect Amazon Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple iterations of the Kindle Fire tablets and these features on this 8" tablet hit all the sweet spots for me. The bezels are not huge (like previous Kindle Fire tablets) and most importantly -- its light enough to hold with one hand without getting arm fatigue. If Amazon was asking me if there was anything to improve on this tablet I would have to say I love the stereo sound, but I wish it would be a tat bit louder. It will be a big seller this Christmas 2020, and I plan on getting another one because of how ridiculously low cost of this tablet is.
customer_reviews.author: Will R

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory "special offers" aka ads in your face 24/7
customer_reviews.text: in the small print under the drop box for the color you choose, is "special offers". "Special offers" is mandatory with purchase. Special offers are the fancy word for giant dumb advertisements. If you enjoy getting slapped in the face with an ad the size of the entire 8"screen litterally everysingle time u press the lock button, then this tablet is for you. The only way to disable ads is to pay jeff bezos an additional 15$. What a joke. Do not buy unless you want to see gardenscapes, township, facebook, and other dumb advertisements 24/7
customer_reviews.author: John Comerato

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT get the version with ads
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Kindle Fires. In fact, this was my 9th one. I bought it because a friend who also loved the HDXs recommended it saying how fast it was. Yeah, yeah. It was great EXCEPT for the ads. And the ads are the reason why I'm returning it. All of my other Kindles had ads. They were unobtrusive and not a problem. The ads on the new Kindles are extremely annoying. One was around the edges of the page, obliterating letters, making it difficult to read. And it kept coming back. So I'm returning it. And I'm so annoyed that I may just get a Samsung Galaxy instead.
customer_reviews.author: petlover1

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Fire and the first one I've been disappointed in. It was also the first time they were not able to transfer my videos, games, etc. from my last Fire to the new one. Although the screen is great and clear, the battery life doesn't seem as long as my previous versions. A call for help did not resolve any issues although she tried and the noise in the background was so loud I'm not sure we even understood each other. Not too happy with Amazon these days.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Reader

customer_reviews.title: Beware: “Special Offers” actually means Constant Ads
customer_reviews.text: Beware special offers. Apparently in the fine print if you select “Special Offers” you agree to constant rolling advertisements on the lock screen of your device that you either have to keep, or pay a “fee” of $15 to remove it. Funny me- when I saw this “promotion” when looking to buy a new Kindle, I thought that Amazon was just doing a promotion on the new device (hence a “special offer”) not that I would become a walking billboard for Amazon and constantly have to avoid accidentally hitting the “buy” buttons for constantly scrolling games/apps/etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!! Extra fees when you receive item!
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that if you buy this item you will have to pay $15 to have the ads removed. They come on when you start up and they interrupt as you use the device. I do not recommend this device to anyone. I had to pay the $15 because my father is elderly and would have been very confused by all of the ads and ended up buying a bunch of things he didn't want. It is worth it to buy a different brand of tablet and just download any apps you want from Amazon. I am so seriously disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ferrick Family

customer_reviews.title: Fire 8 HD: 3 months later - Wifi Connectivity Issues
customer_reviews.text: 3 months in with using this tablet. Can't recommend it over the Fire 7 Tablet. After 5+ years of complaints about Dual-Band wifi compatibility, Fire OS still has troubles with dropping Wifi connections that have 2.4 gHz and 5 gHz bands under the same SSIDs. What you gain with the Fire 8: - The ability to play high-end mobile games at low fps/settings - 2 GB RAM - Slightly better screen than the Fire 7 Biggest Issues with the Fire 8 2020: - Dual-band Wifi incompatibility - Heavier than the Fire 7 - Stuck on old Fire OS software
customer_reviews.author: Kimk166

customer_reviews.title: Seriously?  Second Fire HD 8 in 2 days and same problem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fire HD mostly to use for reading books, and the occasional search online (I like to reference things I am reading about)...The first one I received kept shutting off every time I tried to even get it started. So, they (amazon product support) walked me through a system reboot/reset, which it wouldn't even do, so they sent me a new one. Exact. Same. Problem. Again, they walked me through some troubleshooting and some updates, but it still randomly turned off even while charging with the battery at 60%. Returning, and I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Hagar

customer_reviews.title: Why 1 "overall" stars but 5's for others?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one reason, to be able to help my 85 year old mother with her tablet. I wanted to use AnyDesk to be able to log on and directly manipulate her tablet as it's frequently easier to do things that way than to try to explain - I do this all the time with her computer and it works very well. Imagine my surprise when I discovered that Amazon only allows "viewing" but not direct control. I'm told that Amazon refuses to allow for such remote control - I can't imagine why. The product is good, but it could be MUCH better if they'd allow remote control. So, 1 star, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Not good.  Slow as molasses and extremely limited app support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kid. 90% of what he wants to do is watch videos on Youtube, but you can't even install youtube on this thing. It's also extremely slow to do anything, and the UI for a kids profile is really bad. Very disappointed in this thing, I wish I'd just bought something with stock android on it rather than Amazon's terrible fork of it.
customer_reviews.author: matlok

customer_reviews.title: Traded my ole one in for this!
customer_reviews.text: Did you know that on some tablets amazon offers a trade in of your old devices? It’s fabulous. My sons old tablet stopped charging so I used the trade-in option to upgrade. They initially gave me $5 (remember it doesn’t charge) and 20% off a new tablet so I bought this one. Then after they received my old one they decided it was worth a bit more and issues another $5 credit! Best deal. This new tablet is great but I have noticed the battery does seem to drain pretty fast. That’s my only complaint. Thanks amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding. Awesome deal!
customer_reviews.text: Hey for 59 bucks, you can't expect too much but this one delivers. Smooth video, fast browsing, kindle integration. This tablet is more useful than my $600 "premium" tablet.
customer_reviews.author: H. Drallmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a kindle, but since I read a lot of graphic novels and comics I wanted to be able to read in color. I traded in my old kindle fire 7 and the 8 is so much better! The 8 is faster and I spent a little extra and got the 64 GB version so I have plenty of space and then some. I also like that I was able to get this in white, since my mom already has one in black and I didn't want to confuse the two. The only con is that the kindle fire is a lot heavier than the kindle reader, but I make do.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Lauren (karatheredhead)

customer_reviews.title: Good little tablet to set up for smaller kids, not as great for young teens.
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves it and the ability to set up a profile just for your child is great, but i purchased one for each of my children and i already have family link profiles. This device is not compatible with family link. And my 13 year old uses Adventure academy to learn and stay entertained during this lock down as both of my kids are immunocompromised. Needless to say i can not use or download Adventure academy at all. I wonder about the compatibility with other educational programs. Im a little disappointed, i ordered another for my older son hopefully it will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Catriona

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't offer Google play apps, so disappointed to get just a reader.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an updated tablet mostly for reading my kindle books, so it is perfect for that. I tried to put on an Android app and was unable to. You can only get Amazon apps so I was somewhat surprised and disappointed that I can't have all I had on my old Android tablet. I am happy that I can read with this but hoped for more than a simple Kindle reader. I can also get to my emails, but I don't have access to some of my favorite apps. I will return to my android based tablet for everything but reading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm still learning about this fire tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the screen goes black for a few moments with no reason. Another problem, and I don't know if it's something I don't know about it yet or if it's a problem with the fire tablet, when I change from English to Spanish keyboard it gives me a little trouble. And last, I cannot hook it up to my Roku TV and play TV through my fire tablet, I wasn't aware of that this would be the case. I can use the Roku remote for my TV but there is no option for watching TV programs on the Fire tablet. If I'm wrong about any of this please enlighten me!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Its 'OK'
customer_reviews.text: We had the Fire 8HD Plus but our son lost it. Because we didn't want to spend that amount again for him to lose it again, we went for the Fire 8 HD. And now - Here we are returning it due to this BRAND NEW device being dreadfully slow. If you have patience and your toddler has patience for a new device that is a pretty penny to take its sweet time to load and sync, then this is the product for you! OTHERWISE - Its worth upgrading to the FIRE 8 HD Plus!!
customer_reviews.author: Trent Podritz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tablet
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for our daughter to replace her old Fire tablet that would not charge any longer. This tablet is awesome! The battery life is so much longer and the HD quality is superb. I highly recommend this tablet for kids who enjoy playing kid friendly games and learning apps. I love how I can set this tablet up with parental controls. This ensures she stays away from dangerous or inappropriate apps. Amazon offers a wide variety of apps from learning to just having fun. The kids books are really good as well.
customer_reviews.author: christine spencer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and clunky
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap product with very little practicality outside using it for Amazon functions and watching shows. I ordered it to use for work and you can’t even download regular apps, only Amazon related apps. I don’t know who is giving this 5 stars but it is far from a legit competitor in the tablet market. It couldn’t even connect to my WiFi (75 mbps) properly and it was very awkward in setting up. I’m a tech professional and after 2 hours of trying to get it set up, I put it back in the box and returned it. No thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great streaming long battery life
customer_reviews.text: It is a great unit for my son's needs which really are surf internet and streaming media. It is a nice looking unit the camera is fair. I like the new charging port so I use the same charger on phone. The the video is real clear and hooked to my prime gives him endless music, audio books, and video to choose from. I would recommend this for most folks who truly are just going to stream along with Twitter, Facebook kinda stuff. Beware if you hook your prime account and give It to kids/ anyone they have your credit card.
customer_reviews.author: infideljon

customer_reviews.title: Lots of memory space and speed
customer_reviews.text: I Love this tablet. It's a great size screen, lots of memory and speed. I play games with two accounts on this tablet and it never slows or freezes. It's great for facebook and google searches. I have the blue color and it's so much nicer than plain black. It's easy to update and easy to navigate the settings. I was very happy with the price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Cline

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap android tablet yet, buy it on sale
customer_reviews.text: This new 2020 release (generation 10) of the fire HD8 is a vast improvement over generation 8, with 32 Gb of storage it’s finally got enough space, and it’s significantly faster, for the same price ($60ish on sale, which is often). It’s otherwise largely the same, with unimpressive but adequate performance all around. Amazon’s best compromise yet to make a usable tablet at an absurdly low price. Easy to add google play store and use as normal android device too if one wishes.
customer_reviews.author: Sonoma Mann

customer_reviews.title: Why Can't Amazon Build a Better Device?
customer_reviews.text: I am very familiar with several Amazon kindles. My Newest Kindle Fire HD 8 lasted two weeks. I needed to call customer service because it didn't work. We needed to erase all info and reinstall everything. THE KINDLE LASTED TWO WEEKS! I SPENT $100 TO GET MORE GB. AMAZON KINDLES ARE JUNK. I HAD PROBLEMS WITH ALL OF THEM.
customer_reviews.author: booklover

customer_reviews.title: A great tablet with a few disappointments
customer_reviews.text: Tablet is hard to hold without hitting the control buttons on the side. This is especially frustrating when playing games in landscape mode. Also this tablet requires its own charging device and is not compatible with older Kindle chargers.
customer_reviews.author: Rio's mom

customer_reviews.title: Replacement needed!
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered with a smashed box on one side and upon opening the box found scratches on the screen. Tried to access the replacement field and do not know if replacement was accepted.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that has quit working almost immediately and Amazon will do nothing to help with the issue. I give up. In the garbage it will go. Will never order electronics from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Knudtson

customer_reviews.title: If you still use Fire HDX 8.9 - keep it, don't upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I had to "upgrade" my 4th generation FireHDX 8.9 to 10th generations Fire HD 8 - Amazon dropped HDX version. Fire HD 8 has lower screen quality, much worse resolution, and is smaller. New Fire HD is bit lighter but for some reason, it feels like it weighs more than HDX, probably because it is smaller but thicker so it is more difficult to hold with one hand. With HDX versions out of Amazon's plans, I will be looking for a book reader of better quality from other brands.
customer_reviews.author: scyth

customer_reviews.title: Beware. Just a device to show you ads and monitor what you do.
customer_reviews.text: Fires this up immediately after I received it and immediately started getting served ads - everywhere. On the wallpaper where the icons are, on the home lock screen, etc... It's one big ad device. They also want all you personal info - Amazon account - before you can even download an app that has nothing to do with Amazon. I guess this is the norm these days - give away all your personal data to save $10 on a piece of hardware. My advice - look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be faster than the present Amazon Fire I have. It's not. Slower and I didn't know the size was smaller. I ordered the same size screen protector and case. Big mistake. I wish I had purchased the 16gb instead of the 32gb. Why is this smaller and slower and the power cord is different. Gee thanks. Now I can't use the regular charger. I feel ripped off. Spent more money for a lesser product. Also the Amazon prime movies are blurry. It's not what I expected. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nanjerb

customer_reviews.title: I hate the ads that show up when you turn on the kindle
customer_reviews.text: The fact that I get an ad everytime I start up my kindle really good annoys me and I also wonder who The Washington Post App is such crap when it's owned by Amazon and the app for the iPhone and android is so so much better. The NYtimes app is also junk. It's basically URL for the online version. CRAP. I only bought the kindle to read news. I've charged the kindle once, it's out of battery and I'm reading the news on my phone again. Complete waste.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Very onerous.
customer_reviews.text: Tablet is very onerous if you order the one with advertisement on it, course it’s less expensive. I found it difficult to down load apps like Google Home, Sling connecting with TV connect to Chrome cast etc. Course I use mine mostly for emails, news etc. The internet and WiFi connection works well, so one has to bookmark items to get into places one wants to visit. Granted I’m not a Tech type. The battery life is excellent, bright screen. One can load certain apps but it’s not without effort or knowing the wherewithal. Yes, it’s a great value, but has limitations relative to preinstalled apps and too many advertisements.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: great tablet, not same shape
customer_reviews.text: had another fire 8 with a rubber case, the screen cracked when my wife sat on it, got this one to replace it. absolutely love the tablet but the dimensions are different so it doesn't fit in my cool rubber case/cover which is the only problem with it. LOVE IT, enjoy using it for reading and media, good quality, doesn't heat up, a little thicker than the old fire 8 we had so easier to hold, highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Shane Stout

customer_reviews.title: Fire new disappointing tablet
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is very disappointing. I had to factory reset twice,.games tend to freeze, some apps would not install or not show on the home screen.One game that I had bought said it was installed but it was not.every time I tried to buy it again in would prompt me to open them take me to the app store to open the game. In the plus side it is faster and I like the new charging cord. There is no large or small end so it is easier to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A Idies

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT support Square POS app
customer_reviews.text: That would have been nice to see in a prominent way in the Description... perhaps a simple cautionary note listing apps that Amazon ~knows~ it doesn't support on this tablet. The whole reason I bought a tablet was to use it as a larger format Point of Sale gadget, using the Square app, to more easily serve customers who only carry cards, and want to purchase my books face-to-face. Since the Amazon App Store doesn't carry the Square app (therefore not downloadable), it was pointless for me to keep it. Shame, because the tablet itself looked and handled marvelously... though I paid for the NO AD version, and received the Onboard Ad version. Back to the Factory...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Great solution......with one footnote
customer_reviews.text: My goal in purchasing was to not overload it but use it just for movies, mail and facebook. Perfect! Sort of an accessory to my phone. I"m not a techie. So I've taken advantage of the Fire support. WONDERFUL! No wait. Patient people are their to walk you thru the issues. My only footnote is...at some point during set-up, apparently you decide if ytou will accept advertising on opening. Well, I guess I let then one go by! After set-up, if you remove the advertising, it will cost you about $15!! Thus....I'm living with advertising. Not a deal break. Still really enjoying my fire...Just a lession...READ before moving to the next step!
customer_reviews.author: Bellella

customer_reviews.title: Charging cable too short
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Fire 7 for years and wanted something a little more robust. The HD 8 has more memory and more speed. Just got it so I can't speak to battery life. I'm disappointed that Amazon supplies a cheesy two foot charging cable so it pretty much means you can't use it to read while it's charging. And of course the cable is not an HDMI micro which I have an abundance of several of which are 5 feet long.
customer_reviews.author: 110 In The Shade

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT Kindle tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet! It is fast, touch friendly even through the screen protector. The picture is clear as a bell! (as they say!) All the apps respond virtually immediately and the internet response is amazing! I've yet to encounter any buffering...which to me is awesome! Even when the service is weak, this tablet still has a fast response! The key board is fast as well and the "keys" are large enough to avoid hitting two keys at once. I can't find anything that I don't like about this tablet! I have always had Kindles and every model I've owned, for that time, has been perfect! This model is NO exception! A great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Capricorn54

customer_reviews.title: Adequate Performance...and at a Great Price When on Sale
customer_reviews.text: I paid $49 for this 10-th gen tablet, which included a free case. Any way you slice it, that's a fantastic deal. That said, I'm used to higher-quality tablets. The screen on this one is better than a sharp stick in the eye, but ultimately only adequate. I'm also not fond of where the buttons are placed. And let's not mention the lock screen ads... I'm okay with the Amazon ecosystem, but once I installed the Google Play Store, the tablet became actually useful. In the end, it's like buying a new Ford Focus for $2,000. It's a *great* deal on a serviceable vehicle, but it's still a Ford Focus...
customer_reviews.author: K. Kleinschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Speed!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my Kindle Fire from version 7 to the new 8in screen. My 7 had issues with battery life and video downloading, but I had it for a few years. I travel for work and being able to download from Amazon and Netflix is a MUST! The new Kindle Fire 8 HD is amazing! My only complaint is that it doesn't come with a manual so I had to download a free version to check out the new features added to the newest Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Deatherage

customer_reviews.title: Most earbuds not supported!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed in this tablet. I bought it solely for streaming shows and videos while running on my treadmill. The deal breaker is that all of my wireless earbuds, which I've invested plenty of money in, are not supported because they have a microphone function. I wish I could return it, but I didn't realize this until I already set it up and tested it out without the earbuds. And then, I thought the specific earbuds were the problem, so I bought new ones! I don't know what Amazon is thinking with this...
customer_reviews.author: Rstep

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tablet
customer_reviews.text: The tablet meets the needs I have for using a tablet of this size. Will I be doing photo or audio editing on it? No. It's not designed to replace a high-end laptop, Chromebook, desktop, or a high-end tablet. If you're going to use it as a lightweight, easily and conveniently carried tablet to have with you for emailing, checking out the stuff on the web, listening to music, reading a book, and even ordering more stuff from Amazon, then I recommend this. The display is quite good. Also, it is reasonably fast. I grew frustrated with the slowness of the 7" Fire. The Fire 8 is noticeably better than the Fire 7 for not too much more money.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Sachais

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I've bought either, 6 or 8 Kindles. I've gotten 2 childrens editions and the rest have been the Fire edition as gifts and several for myself because I literally use mine 12 to 16 hours a day as I am bedridden. I love the things. They last longer than any laptop I've had and are easier for me to handle and use. They are portable and convenient for bedside table. The camera stinks, it does store and transfer pictures though. The internet browser ( Silk only ) is limited so beware and check that out before buying. They have short charger cords and using non-brands will burn your Kindle out. ( it did mine )
customer_reviews.author: CrazyBird

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: My fault but I thought I was ordering a regular size tablet and the 8"isn't much bigger than my phone. I am disappointed but mostly in myself. It's great for the most part but has a lot of Amazon territory on it. I don't think I will get much use out of it. It's just not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Worst yet!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I keep buying kindles. This is like my family 6th or 7th 1.They don't get any better this 1 is the worst 1 yet
customer_reviews.author: All-access Customer

customer_reviews.title: 10 th generation is the best
customer_reviews.text: I like this version much more. I had the fire 7 and upgraded to fire 8 (8 th generation) I didn't care for the 8 much. But I recently dropped it and cracked the screen. So for my birthday I received the fire 8 ( 10 th generation) and I'm very happy with it. It reminds me of my original kindle and doesn't have the long squared edges of the 8 th. I like this one a lot so I bought it a case.
customer_reviews.author: GMM

customer_reviews.title: Too many apps I'll never use.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third tablet. It has the most internal storage of all but my other tablets let me use Google play for a lot of my apps I use all of the time. This time it was harder to get some of my apps on this tablet. Only one other complaint and that is there are quite a few apps already installed on the tablet. Most of them I will never use. The issue is I can't uninstall any of them. Specifically Amazon apps is fine but games or shopping apps I won't use is just a waste of space which is why I bought this tablet with 64gb instead of 32gb.
customer_reviews.author: susan caton

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Kindle Fire Tablet for Us
customer_reviews.text: This Fire 8 Plus is our fourth Kindle Fire tablet in our family. We began 2012 with two 7" Kindle Fire tablets. Those have worked perfectly since new. However, those tablets do not support the latest Kindle reader features, so we retired those for the current generation of the Kindle Fire 10 and Fire 8 Plus tablets. The new tablets, like our originals, work perfectly. We are able to install non-Amazon apps, like the Cloud Reader so we can download and read books from our local public library. The Amazon Kindle Fire tablets are clearly a winner. The cost is way below other tablets on the market.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wight

customer_reviews.title: Glitches
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this tablet 2 stars because of the glitches. At any given time the screen just blinks out and comes right back on as well as makes the sound as if it's rebooting itself. Its hard to enjoy your book or movie with this happening, so AMAZON please correct this. Update: After posting this review I was immediately contacted by customer service who suggested we do a factory restore which we did. So far so good even though my apps did not cross over but that's the least of my worries.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyers remorse
customer_reviews.text: If you liked the loading screens of yesteryear, then this p.o.s. Is 4 u. What did the snail say to the turtle he was riding? Weeee. I.e. don’t waste your $, or you’ll be wasting your time.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade to an existing HD8, so it is significantly faster and the battery charges very quickly. Did not like that it does not have a Contact icon and I had to manually enter all of my addresses into the email system. Also no longer allows third party software to be loaded and one of my favorite weather programs, Weatherbug, is no longer in the App Store for this tablet. Also, I tried via my device account to unsubscribe from the startup ads by paying the $15 fee, but that never worked and after two long discussions with tech support was not able to resolve, so ended up cancelling the change and getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar W. Reynolds Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase as a daily driver... Much dissapoint.
customer_reviews.text: Not a great tablet, but you get what you pay for. I only bought this tablet for taking on trips so that I can have a connection to the world in the event that I break my phone (which happened recently). It's incredibly slow, though I've only used it for about a week, and it's asinine that you have to pay extra to get one that doesn't have ads on the lockscreen. The slowness can be attributed to the lacking specs and Amazon's stupidly bloated Android skin. Amazon needs to get over itself and either use traditional Android OS or else develop their own. It's amazing that anybody considers this tablet for anything more than a backup device.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Two attempts; both FIRE 8 turn off when l don't want them to.
customer_reviews.text: This is the replacement peacock blue FIRE for the plum FIRE I purchased in late August. lt has the SAME PROBLEM. If l set it for text-to- speech, it will read for about 5 minutes & then stop, screen black, until l turn it on again, sometimes even having to find the book all over again. This is especially upsetting when l set it to read while l am falling asleep. It also turns itself off if l carry it around doing housework. That was the reason l purchased it..l love to read ALL THE TIME but it is abominably frustrating. If others do not have this problem, let.me know & l'll send it back again.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Vitek

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Since I recently started using the 8" Kindle, battery life is excellent. I can use it all day long, without any problems. I'll come back to this subject after I have used it for a year. I have not seen a movie on it yet, so I can't tell you how well the battery works if you watch one or more movies in a day in addition to the normal stuff you do on it. The touch screen is excellent, and the resolution is very good. I gave this Kindle 4 out of 5 stars, because the download speed needs to be faster. Overall, I do recommend this Kindle, especially if speed does not matter.
customer_reviews.author: Sholamit

customer_reviews.title: All Fires are not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fire tablets. I just got my fifth one recently. I traded in two o my older ones. Usually there are no problems. I will need to return this one for a replacement. Something is very wrong with the earbud jack. It takes the strength of ten to get it in and sheer luck getting it out. I destroyed one set of earbuds last week. I usually use wireless but always need the wired ones. Since this will be the second Fire tablet return out of five, I took a star away. Frequently used apps one all platforms are becoming fewer and fewer in the Apps Store. No Instagram. No Scrabble.
customer_reviews.author: Bel-ami

product_meta.title: All-new Fire HD 8 tablet, 8" HD display, 32 GB, designed for portable entertainment, Twilight Blue
feature_bullets: 8" HD display, 2X the storage (32 or 64 GB of internal storage and up to 1 TB with microSD card) + 2 GB RAM.
All-day battery life - Up to 12 hours of reading, browsing the web, watching videos, and listening to music.
Now with USB-C for easier charging. Fully charges in under 5 hours (with included cable + adapter).
30% faster thanks to the new 2.0 GHz quad-core processor.
Enjoy your favorite apps like Netflix, Facebook, Hulu, Instagram, TikTok, and more through Amazon’s Appstore (Google Play not supported).
Introducing Game Mode - A distraction-free and optimized gaming experience.
Hands-free with Alexa, including on/off toggle.
2 MP front and rear-facing cameras with 720p HD video recording.
